instruction: What is the purpose of the Privacy Policy?
response: The Privacy Policy describes the college's policies and procedures on the collection, use, and disclosure of user information when using the Service and informs users about their privacy rights.

instruction: What kind of data does the college collect?

instruction: What is usage data?
response: Usage data is collected automatically when using the Service and includes information such as device's Internet Protocol address, browser type, browser version, and other diagnostic data.

instruction: What are cookies and how are they used?
response: Cookies are small files placed on your device by a website, containing browsing history information. The college uses cookies to track activity on the Service, store information, and improve the Service. Learn more about cookies: https://www.termsfeed.com/blog/cookies/.

instruction: What are the different types of cookies used by the college?
response: The college uses both session and persistent cookies, including necessary/essential cookies to provide services through the website and to enable users to use some of its features.

instruction: How can I refuse cookies?
response: You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some parts of the Service.

instruction: What is an account and how is it used?
response: An account is a unique account created for users to access the college's Service or parts of the Service. It allows users to log in and access specific features and services.

instruction: What is the college's definition of personal data?
response: Personal data refers to any information that relates to an identified or identifiable individual.

instruction: Who is the service provider?
response: The service provider refers to any natural or legal person who processes data on behalf of the college, including third-party companies or individuals employed by the college to facilitate the Service.

instruction: What is the Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: The Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology is a government institute under the Chandigarh UT Administration, affiliated to Panjab University, Chandigarh.

instruction: What are the academic departments at CCET?
response: The academic departments at CCET include Computer Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electronics And Communication Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Applied Science.

instruction: What are the programs offered at CCET?
response: CCET offers Degree Courses, Degree Course (PU-LEET), and Doctorate (PhD) programs. For more information, please visit [https://www.ccet.ac.in/degreeCourse.php](https://www.ccet.ac.in/degreeCourse.php).

instruction: How do I apply for admissions at CCET?
response: You can apply for admissions at CCET through the Joint Admission Committee (JAC) portal [https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/](https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/).

instruction: What are the eligibility criteria for admissions at CCET?
response: The eligibility criteria for admissions at CCET are available on the JAC website [https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/eligibility-status/](https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/eligibility-status/).

instruction: What student services are available at CCET?
response: CCET offers various student services, including student forms, education loan, national apprenticeship training, scholarships, and student grievances redressal system. For more information, please visit [https://www.ccet.ac.in/forms.php](https://www.ccet.ac.in/forms.php).

instruction: How can I contact CCET?
response: You can contact CCET through their website [http://www.ccet.ac.in/](http://www.ccet.ac.in/) or by emailing [pr@ccet.ac.in](mailto:pr@ccet.ac.in).

instruction: What are the facilities available at CCET?
response: CCET offers various facilities, including class rooms, canteen, infrastructure, sports facility, and campus virtual tour. For more information, please visit [https://www.ccet.ac.in/classRooms.php](https://www.ccet.ac.in/classRooms.php).

instruction: What are the different academic departments at CCET?
response: CCET has various academic departments such as Computer Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Applied Science. You can find more information at [http://ccet.ac.in/CSE-overview.php](http://ccet.ac.in/CSE-overview.php), [http://ccet.ac.in/MECH-overview.php](http://ccet.ac.in/MECH-overview.php), and other departmental pages.

You can find more information about each department by visiting their respective pages: [CSE](http://www.ccet.ac.in/CSE-overview.php), [MECH](http://www.ccet.ac.in/MECH-overview.php), [ECE](http://www.ccet.ac.in/ECE-overview.php), [CIVIL](http://www.ccet.ac.in/CIVIL-overview.php), and [AS](http://www.ccet.ac.in/AS-overview.php).

instruction: What are the admission procedures at CCET?
response: The admission procedures at CCET involve applying through the Joint Admission Committee (JAC) portal. You can find more information about the admission process, eligibility criteria, and counselling schedule on the [Admissions](http://www.ccet.ac.in/ECE-overview.php#) page or the [JAC](https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/) portal.

instruction: What are the different programmes offered at CCET?
response: CCET offers various programmes including Degree Course, Degree Course (PU-LEET), and Doctorate (PhD). You can find more information about each programme on the [Programmes](http://www.ccet.ac.in/degreeCourse.php) page.

instruction: What are the facilities available at CCET?
response: CCET has various facilities including classrooms, canteen, infrastructure, and sports facilities. You can take a [Campus Virtual Tour](http://www.ccet.ac.in/campusTour.php) to explore the campus.

instruction: How do I access student resources at CCET?
response: Students can access various resources including student forms, education loan, national apprenticeship training, scholarships, and student grievances redressal system on the [Student Section](http://www.ccet.ac.in/ECE-overview.php#) page.

instruction: What is the academic calendar at CCET?
response: The academic calendar at CCET can be found on the [Academic Calender](http://www.ccet.ac.in/academicCalendar.php) page.

response: The vision and mission of CCET can be found on the [Vision and Mission](http://www.ccet.ac.in/history.php#vissionAndMission) page.

instruction: How do I reach CCET?
response: You can find directions to reach CCET on the [How To Reach Us](http://www.ccet.ac.in/visit.php) page.

instruction: What is the CCET | ECE Overview page about?
response: The CCET | ECE Overview page provides an overview of the Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology (Degree Wing) and its various departments, programmes, and facilities.

instruction: What is the purpose of the CCET website?
response: The CCET website provides information about the college, its administration, academics, admissions, and student-related activities. It also provides links to various resources, such as downloads, contact information, and social media profiles.

instruction: How do I navigate the CCET website?
response: You can navigate the website by clicking on the main sections, such as 'About Us', 'Admissions', 'Academics', and 'Student Section'. Each section has sub-sections that provide more specific information.

instruction: What is the history of CCET?
response: You can find information about the history of CCET by visiting the 'About Us' section and clicking on the 'History' sub-section. [http://ccet.ac.in/history.php](http://ccet.ac.in/history.php)

instruction: What are the academic departments available at CCET?
response: CCET has several academic departments, including Computer Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Applied Science. You can find more information about each department by visiting the 'Academics' section.

instruction: How do I apply for admission to CCET?
response: You can find information about the admission process by visiting the 'Admissions' section. This section provides links to admission notices, help desk, and information about the different programs offered, such as degree courses and PhD programs.

instruction: What is JAC and how does it relate to CCET?
response: JAC stands for Joint Admission Committee, and it is responsible for conducting admissions to various engineering colleges, including CCET. You can find more information about JAC by visiting the 'Admissions' section and clicking on the 'JAC' sub-section. [https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/](https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/)

instruction: What are the eligibility criteria for admission to CCET?
response: You can find information about the eligibility criteria by visiting the 'Admissions' section and clicking on the 'Criteria' sub-section. [https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/eligibility-status/](https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/eligibility-status/)

instruction: What resources are available for students at CCET?
response: CCET provides various resources for students, including student forms, education loans, apprenticeship training, scholarships, and a student grievance redressal system. For more information, visit https://www.ccet.ac.in/CSE-overview.php, https://www.ccet.ac.in/MECH-overview.php, https://www.ccet.ac.in/ECE-overview.php, https://www.ccet.ac.in/CIVIL-overview.php, and https://www.ccet.ac.in/AS-overview.php.

response: The Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology offers programs such as Degree Course, Degree Course (PU-LEET), and Doctorate (Phd). For more information, visit https://www.ccet.ac.in/degreeCourse.php, https://www.ccet.ac.in/leetAdmission.php, and https://www.ccet.ac.in/phd.php.

instruction: What is the aim of IIEDC?
response: The aim of IIEDC is to help young engineers become job providers with innovative hi-tech ventures, and to lead the nation towards industrial excellence and self-reliance.

instruction: What is the objective of IIEDC?
response: The objective of IIEDC is to develop the spirit of Innovation and Entrepreneurship among talented budding engineers.

instruction: What activities does IIEDC engage in?
response: IIEDC engages in creating Awareness Programmes, Mentoring Students, and Assisting in getting financial support for Startups, as well as providing guidance and mentoring for initiating, planning, and launching successful economic viable units.

instruction: Who is the Coordinator of IIEDC?
response: Dr. Ashwani Kumar is the Coordinator of IIEDC. You can learn more about him on the [IIEDC website](http://ccet.ac.in/iiedc/index.html).

instruction: Who is the Professor In-charge of IIEDC?
response: Dr. D. S. Saini is the Professor In-charge of IIEDC. You can learn more about him on the [IIEDC website](http://ccet.ac.in/iiedc/index.html).

instruction: What kind of support does IIEDC provide to students?
response: IIEDC provides constant guidance, mentoring, and financial support to students, as well as access to various programs and schemes of the Government.

instruction: What is the aim of IIEDC?
response: The aim of IIEDC is to help young engineers move out of being job seekers and become job providers with innovative hi-tech ventures, leading the nation towards industrial excellence and self-reliance.

instruction: What is the objective of IIEDC?
response: The objective of IIEDC is to develop the spirit of Innovation and Entrepreneurship among talented budding engineers.

instruction: What kind of activities does IIEDC engage in?
response: IIEDC engages in creating Awareness Programmes, Mentoring Students, and Assisting in getting financial support for Startups. instruction: What are the different scholarships and fee concessions provided?
response: The college provides U.T Merit Scholarships, Free Education for Meritorious Scheduled Castes and Other Backward Classes Students, Merit-cum means based scholarship to minority communities, Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme for Economically Weaker Section students, and Half free ship on tuition fee for Schedule Caste/ Schedule Tribes students. Details are available in the prospectus 2016-17.

instruction: What are the minimum eligibility criteria for admission?
response: The minimum eligibility criteria for admission are as follows: the candidate must have passed 10+2 examination with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the following subjects: Chemistry, Biotechnology, Computer Science, or Biology. Additionally, a candidate must have obtained a minimum of 60% marks in the qualifying examination for admission to the first year B.E. and Integrated B.E. courses, and 55% for SC/ST/Physically Handicapped categories.

instruction: What is the admission process procedure?
response: The admission process procedure involves admission to the First Semester course in any branch through a mode decided by the P.U. Syndicate, based on JEE (Mains) merit conducted by CBSE. For lateral entry, admission to the Second year B.E Programme is based on merit obtained in the Entrance Examination conducted by the Panjab University.

instruction: If I do not get the preference of my choice, will I be considered for other branches?
response: Yes, if you do not get the preference of your choice, you will be considered for other branches based on your merit and vacancy available in other branches.

instruction: What are the departments available in CCET?
response: CCET has several departments, including Computer Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Applied Science. Each department has its own faculty and offers specialized courses and programs.

response: CCET offers various programs, including degree courses, degree courses (PU-LEET), and doctorate (Ph.D.) programs. The institute also offers specialized programs in collaboration with industries and other institutions.

instruction: What is the Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: The Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology is a Government Institute under the Chandigarh UT Administration, affiliated with Panjab University, Chandigarh.

instruction: What is the vision and mission of the college?
response: The vision and mission of the college can be found on the [Vision and Mission](https://www.ccet.ac.in/history.php#vissionAndMission) page.

instruction: How do I contact the college?
response: You can contact the college through their [Contact Us](https://www.ccet.ac.in/contact.php) page or visit them at their campus located at [Campus Map](https://www.ccet.ac.in/campus.php).

instruction: What are the academic departments offered by the college?
response: The college offers various academic departments including [Computer Science Engineering](https://www.ccet.ac.in/CSE-overview.php), [Mechanical Engineering](https://www.ccet.ac.in/MECH-overview.php), [Electronics and Communication Engineering](https://www.ccet.ac.in/ECE-overview.php), [Civil Engineering](https://www.ccet.ac.in/CIVIL-overview.php), and [Applied Science](https://www.ccet.ac.in/AS-overview.php).

instruction: How do I apply for admission to the college?
response: The admission process can be found on the [Admissions](https://www.ccet.ac.in/AS-syllabus.php#) page, which includes [Admission Notices](https://www.ccet.ac.in/admission_notices.php), [Help Desk](https://www.ccet.ac.in/HelpDesk.php), and [JAC](https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/) information.

instruction: What are the academic programs offered by the college?
response: The college offers various academic programs including [Degree Course](https://www.ccet.ac.in/degreeCourse.php), [Degree Course (PU-LEET)](https://www.ccet.ac.in/leetAdmission.php), and [Doctorate (Phd)](https://www.ccet.ac.in/phd.php).

instruction: What are the eligibility criteria for admission to the college?
response: The eligibility criteria can be found on the [Eligibility](https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/eligibility-status/) page.

instruction: What are the facilities provided by the college?
response: The college provides various facilities including [Campus Virtual Tour](https://www.ccet.ac.in/campusTour.php), [Class Rooms](https://www.ccet.ac.in/classRooms.php), [Canteen](https://www.ccet.ac.in/canteen.php), [Infrastructure](https://www.ccet.ac.in/infrastructure.php), [Sports Facility](https://www.ccet.ac.in/sportsFacility.php), and more.

instruction: What are the student welfare services provided by the college?
response: The college provides various student welfare services including [Scholarships](https://www.ccet.ac.in/scholarship.php), [Vidya Lakshmi Education Loan](https://www.vidyalakshmi.co.in/Students/indexPopup), [National Apprenticeship Training](http://mhrdnats.gov.in/), and more.

instruction: How do I pay my fees?
response: You can pay your fees through the [Student Fee Payment (HDFC)](https://paydirect.eduqfix.com/app/3qTjKfysWsfqEyNTM4giVFX4VGVYGZss5NYRHpY65DaJgmu14S3Ff6NKoVa3l2Ay/6593) link.

instruction: What are the hostel facilities provided by the college?
response: The college provides [Boys Hostel](https://www.ccet.ac.in/hostelboys.php) and [Girls Hostel](https://www.ccet.ac.in/hostelgirls.php) facilities.

instruction: What are the events and activities conducted by the college?
response: The college conducts various events and activities including [Student Chapters/Clubs](https://www.ccet.ac.in/studentClubList.php), [Apratim](http://apratim.ccet.ac.in/), [ACM @ CCET](http://ccet.acm.org/), [ASME @ CCET](https://sites.google.com/view/asme-ccet-student-section/home/about), [NSS](https://www.ccet.ac.in/nss.php), and more.

instruction: How do I access the placement information?
response: The placement information can be found on the [Placements](http://ccet.ac.in/tnp/index.html) page.

instruction: What are the NIRF reports of the college?
response: The NIRF reports can be found on the [NIRF](https://www.ccet.ac.in/AS-syllabus.php#) page, including [NIRF Report 2023](https://www.ccet.ac.in/pdf/NIRFReport2023.pdf), [NIRF Report 2022](https://www.ccet.ac.in/pdf/NIRF2022Report.pdf), and more.

response: The notices and announcements can be found on the [Notices](https://www.ccet.ac.in/notices.php) page.

instruction: What is the main function of the Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: The Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology (CCET) is a government institute that provides higher education in the fields of engineering, technology, and sciences. It offers various undergraduate and postgraduate programs, as well as research facilities for PhD students.

instruction: How do I apply for admission to Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: You can apply for admission to Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology by visiting their website and following the admission process, which includes filling out the application form, submitting required documents, and appearing for counseling. You can also check the 'Admissions' section for more information.

instruction: What are the facilities available for students at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: The facilities available for students at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology include a library, sports facilities, hostel accommodation, and more. You can check the 'Student Section' and 'Facilities' sections on the website for more information.

instruction: How do I pay my fees at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: You can pay your fees at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology through the HDFC payment gateway, which is available on the website. You can also check the 'Student Section' for more information on fee payment.

instruction: What is the student grievance redressal system at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: The student grievance redressal system at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology is an online portal where students can submit their grievances and track their status. You can access the portal through the 'Student Section' on the website.

instruction: What are the student chapters and clubs available at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: The student chapters and clubs available at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology include Apratim, ACM, ASME, and NSS, among others. You can check the 'Student Section' for more information on the various student chapters and clubs.

instruction: How do I contact the helpdesk at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: You can contact the helpdesk at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology through email or phone, and also through the 'Helpdesk' section on the website. The helpdesk provides assistance with admissions, academics, and other queries.

instruction: What is Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology (CCET)?
response: CCET is a government institute under Chandigarh UT Administration and is affiliated to Panjab University, Chandigarh. [Learn more](https://www.ccet.ac.in/)

instruction: What are the academic departments at CCET?
response: CCET has the following academic departments: Computer Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Applied Science. [Explore](https://www.ccet.ac.in/)

instruction: What programs are offered at CCET?
response: CCET offers Degree Courses (B.E.), Degree Course (PU-LEET), and Doctorate (Ph.D.) programs. [Know more](https://www.ccet.ac.in/MECH-overview.php#)

instruction: What is the admission process at CCET?
response: The admission process involves registration on the JAC portal, online counselling, and document verification. [Learn more](https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/)

instruction: What are the eligibility criteria for admission to CCET?
response: The eligibility criteria include minimum qualifying marks in 10+2 or equivalent examination, age limit, and other specific requirements. [Check eligibility](https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/eligibility-status/)

instruction: What student services are available at CCET?
response: CCET offers various student services, including academic support, hostel facilities, sports facilities, and student welfare services. [Explore](https://www.ccet.ac.in/MECH-overview.php#)

instruction: What is a ParamValidationError?
response: A ParamValidationError is an error that occurs when there is an issue with a URL parameter, such as an invalid protocol. It returns a 400 status code and a readable error message describing the issue.

instruction: What causes a ParamValidationError?
response: A ParamValidationError can be caused by specifying an invalid protocol in a URL, such as 'mailto:' instead of 'http://' or 'https://'. This error can also occur due to other malformed URL parameters.

instruction: How do I fix a ParamValidationError?
response: To fix a ParamValidationError, review the URL parameters and ensure they are correctly formatted. Check that the protocol is valid (e.g., 'http://' or 'https://') and that all required parameters are present. If you're still experiencing issues, refer to the API documentation or contact the support team for further assistance.

instruction: What does the readableMessage field indicate?
response: The readableMessage field provides a human-readable description of the error, making it easier to understand and debug the issue. In this case, the readableMessage is 'ParamValidationError(url): Invalid protocol mailto:' which clearly indicates the problem is with the URL protocol.

instruction: What is Model United Nations?
response: Model United Nations is an exemplary simulation of the United Nations, wherein participants role play as delegates from different countries and collectively form policies to solve burning issues of the world.

instruction: What is the agenda for the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) at the Chroma event?
response: The agenda for the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) at the Chroma event is Disarmament & Peacekeeping in conflict ridden zones with special emphasis on Israel Palestine War.

instruction: What are the basic rules of procedure for the Chroma event?
response: The basic rules of procedure include delegates starting with a general speakers list (GSL) which is 90 seconds in duration, and points such as point of information, point of parliamentary inquiry, point of order, and point of personal privilege that shape up the debate.

instruction: What is a Moderated Caucus?
response: A Moderated Caucus is a session of debating that deliberates upon the sub-topics of the main agenda.

instruction: What is an Unmoderated Caucus?
response: An Unmoderated Caucus is an informal session in which the delegates discuss the pathway for moving the committee forward.

instruction: What is CCET?
response: Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology (CCET) is a government institute under Chandigarh UT Administration and affiliated with Panjab University, Chandigarh. It offers various undergraduate and postgraduate programs in engineering, technology, and management.

instruction: What are the programs offered by CCET?
response: CCET offers undergraduate programs in B.E. (Computer Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Applied Science), postgraduate programs, and Ph.D. programs. For more information, please visit the [Academics](https://www.ccet.ac.in/academics.php) section.

instruction: How to reach CCET?
response: CCET is located in Sector 26, Chandigarh. For detailed directions, please visit the [How to Reach Us](https://www.ccet.ac.in/visit.php) section.

instruction: What is the eligibility criteria for admission to CCET?
response: The eligibility criteria for admission to CCET vary depending on the program. For undergraduate programs, students must have passed 10+2 with at least 60% marks in Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. For postgraduate programs, students must have a valid GATE score and a bachelor's degree in the relevant field. For more information, please visit the [Admissions](https://www.ccet.ac.in/admissions.php) section.

instruction: What are the facilities available at CCET?
response: CCET has modern infrastructure, including state-of-the-art laboratories, computer centers, a library, canteen, and sports facilities. The college also has separate hostels for boys and girls. For more information, please visit the [Infrastructure](https://www.ccet.ac.in/infrastructure.php) section.

instruction: What are the different scholarships and fee concessions provided?
response: The following scholarships are available to the students in the college: U.T Merit Scholarships, Free Education for Meritorious Scheduled Castes and Other Backward Classes Students, Merit-cum means based scholarship to minority communities, Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme for Economically Weaker Section students, and Half free ship on tuition fee shall be admissible to all the students belonging to the Schedule Caste/ Schedule Tribes.

instruction: What are the minimum eligibility criteria for admission?
response: The admission criteria are as follows: The candidate must have passed 10+2 examination of the Central Board of Secondary Education, New Delhi or its equivalent with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the following subjects : Chemistry, Biotechnology, Computer Science or Biology. A candidate must have obtained a minimum of 60% marks in the qualifying examination i.e. +2 for admission to the first year B.E. and Integrated B.E. courses in all the University Engineering Departments and Colleges affiliated to it except in the case of SC/ST/Physically Handicapped categories for which the percentage shall be 55% for admission to Engineering courses.

instruction: What is the procedure for admission?
response: The mode of admission to the First Semester course in any branch will be decided by the P.U. Syndicate. It will be open to a candidate, who has passed 10+2 examination of the Central Board of Secondary Education, New Delhi or its equivalent with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the following subjects : Chemistry, Biotechnology, Computer Science or Biology. The candidates shall be admitted on the basis of JEE (Mains) merit conducted by CBSE.

instruction: What is the criteria for lateral entry admission?
response: The mode of admission to the Second year B.E Programme (lateral entry) where ever applicable will be decided by the P.U Syndicate from time to time. It will be open to a candidate who has passed 3year Diploma from the recognized State Board of Technical Education in India with 60% marks in the aggregate.

instruction: What are the different scholarships and fee concessions provided?
response: The following scholarships are available to the students in the college: U.T Merit Scholarships, Free Education for Meritorious Scheduled Castes and Other Backward Classes Students, Merit-cum means based scholarship to minority communities, Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme for Economically Weaker Section students, and Half free ship on tuition fee shall be admissible to all the students belonging to the Schedule Caste/ Schedule Tribes. Details of above and other fee concession are available in prospectus 2016-17.

instruction: What are the minimum eligibility criteria for admission?
response: The admission criteria are as follows: the candidate must have passed 10+2 examination of the Central Board of Secondary Education, New Delhi or its equivalent with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the following subjects : Chemistry, Biotechnology, Computer Science or Biology. A candidate must have obtained a minimum of 60% marks in the qualifying examination i.e. +2 for admission to the first year B.E. and Integrated B.E. courses in all the University Engineering Departments and Colleges affiliated to it except in the case of SC/ST/Physically Handicapped categories for which the percentage shall be 55% for admission to Engineering courses.

instruction: What are the modes of admission to the First Semester course?
response: The mode of admission to the First Semester course in any branch will be decided by the P.U. Syndicate. It will be open to a candidate, who has passed 10+2 examination of the Central Board of Secondary Education, New Delhi or its equivalent with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the following subjects : Chemistry, Biotechnology, Computer Science or Biology.

instruction: What is the admission procedure for Second year B.E Programme (lateral entry)?
response: The mode of admission to the Second year B.E Programme (lateral entry) where ever applicable will be decided by the P.U Syndicate from time to time. It will be open to a candidate who has passed 3year Diploma from the recognized State Board of Technical Education in India with 60% marks in the aggregate. The admission will only be made in the corresponding or allied discipline.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: To establish an outstanding center of regional and national reputation for providing a quality engineering education to the students and services to the professionals and the community; to produce quality civil engineers; and to employ principles of continual quality improvement to enhance competence of its programme and faculty. [Learn more](http://ccet.ac.in/CIVIL-overview.php)

response: Eligibility criteria vary by program, but general information is available at https://jacchd.admissions.nic.in/eligibility-status/.

response: Rules include vaccination, RT-PCR report requirements, community living, and prohibition of gambling and substance abuse.

response: The motto of Apostle of Speech is 'silence unjustified', which means that they believe in speaking up and making oneself heard.

response: RobokNox aims to achieve innovative solutions to everyday problems through innovation and robotics, following their motto 'Create, Innovate, Automate'.

instruction: What is Punjabi By Nature, the Bhangra Club, all about?
response: Punjabi By Nature represents the culture and history of Punjab and provides an environment for self-expression, growth, and success through dance, following the core values of unity, love, and family.

response: Dramebaaz aims to educate the society through their performances, which include street plays and flash mobs.

response: 7 Notes believes that music is everywhere, and it's just how you comprehend it.

instruction: What is the Writeathon event about?
response: The Writeathon event is an online writing event hosted on Unstop, where participants will write articles on tracks announced before the fest.

instruction: Are there any rules for submitting articles?
response: Yes, please ensure that your article is original and does not replicate any previously published work, including your own. Also, do not submit your article for review elsewhere while under consideration at our event.

instruction: What are the word count requirements for article submissions?
response: Please ensure that your article falls within the range of 700 to 1000 words, maintaining this word limit.

instruction: How should I submit my article?
response: Please submit your article as an attachment in Word format. Additionally, if your article includes tables and figures, kindly send them as separate attachments in .jpg format via email.

instruction: Are there any specific formatting guidelines for article submissions?
response: Yes, please limit your use of headings to no more than two hierarchical levels. Also, include proper credits for any attached images and provide links to their sources.

instruction: Can I submit an article that has been published previously?
response: No, please ensure that all content is original and has not been published previously. Work that does not qualify for our plagiarism check will not be shortlisted.

instruction: What is the history of Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: The college was established in 1959 as a joint venture of the Government of India and the Government of Punjab. It was developed as a technical institute for the students of Punjab, Haryana, and the surrounding areas. The college was affiliated with the University of Punjab for the first time in 1960.

Details of these scholarships and concessions are available in the prospectus 2016-17.

instruction: What are the minimum eligibility criteria for admission?
response: The minimum eligibility criteria for admission include 10+2 examination of the Central Board of Secondary Education, New Delhi or its equivalent with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the following subjects: Chemistry, Biotechnology, Computer Science, or Biology. A minimum of 60% marks in the qualifying examination is required, with a 55% mark for SC/ST/Physically Handicapped categories.

instruction: If I do not get the preference of my choice, will it be possible to transfer my branch after the first year?
response: Yes, it is possible to change branches, but it would be as per the Panjab University guidelines amended from time to time.

instruction: How to get provisional certificate, character certificate, bonafide certificate, and scholarship certificate from the college?
response: Students should fill the prescribed performa available on the CCET website. Students need to clear all their dues before the certificate is issued.

instruction: What are the regulations issued by Panjab University to earn a B.E. degree in any mentioned stream?
response: The regulations include a minimum of 75% attendance in classes, with the power to condone a shortage of up to 10% per subject. A candidate will be promoted to the next year only if they have earned 50% of the total credits of the preceding years. The course duration is four years, comprising eight semesters, with two semesters per year.

instruction: What is the procedure to get admission to the second year B.E. program (lateral entry)?
response: Admission to the second year B.E. program (lateral entry) is decided by the P.U. Syndicate. It is open to a candidate who has passed a 3-year diploma from a recognized State Board of Technical Education in India with 60% marks in aggregate. Admission will be made on the basis of merit obtained in the Entrance Examination conducted by the Panjab University.

instruction: What are the rules regarding maintenance of discipline in the hostel?
response: 1. Individuals with One Dose of Covid-19 Vaccination and negative report of RT-PCR in last 72 hours are allowed in hostels. 2. The residents are expected to live in the hostel as a community and with a full sense of responsibility. 3. The residents are not allowed to gamble in the hostel premises. 4. The residents are not allowed to bring intoxicants and take part in activities of intoxication in any form in the hostel premises. 5. The residents are not allowed to keep guests in their rooms, except with the prior written permission of the Hostel Warden. 6. The residents shall not commit any breach of peace in the hostel premises. 7. The residents shall not invite undesirable elements into the hostel premises. 8. The residents are not permitted to stay overnight out of their hostels, or go out of station without prior permission of the Hostel Warden. 9. The residents are not permitted to install and use any electric appliance except a wall light, a table lamp and a table fan for their rooms. A breach of this rule result in the forfeiture of the appliance seized. 10. Residents are not permitted to keep with them any offensive weapon, such as firearms, Kirpan or Khukhri, etc. Strict action will be taken against anyone found in possession of such a weapon. 11. A Hostel Discipline committee comprising of senior and nominated members shall assist the Hostel Warden in monitoring the discipline in the Hostel. 12. A resident shall not keep cash exceeding Rs. 500/- with him in room. Cash in excess of this shall be deposited with the accountant/Mess Manager. 13. The residents are not allowed to keep costly items like T.V., Computers, Stereo decks etc. in their rooms. 14. The allotment of seats rests with the Hostel warden No boarder is allowed to change his room or furniture without prior permission of the authorities. This will apply even if the change is mutual. 15. Students are expected to refrain from disfiguring walls, doors etc. and removal of glass panes. This will help towards better maintenance of the hostel. 16. Boarders, who are in arrears of any mess bill for more than a month, shall have to vacate their seats in the hostel. 17. Habitual defiance of any of the Hostel Rules/Instructions will render resident student liable to disciplinary action. 18. These rules may be amended, substituted, or deleted without notice.

instruction: What is the National Service Scheme (NSS)?
response: The National Service Scheme (NSS) is a program under the Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports, Government of India, that aims to develop the personality of students by involving them in community service.

instruction: What is the motto of the National Service Scheme (NSS)?
response: The motto of the National Service Scheme (NSS) is 'Not Me But You', which reflects the essence of democratic living and upholds the need for self-less service.

instruction: What are the main objectives of the National Service Scheme (NSS)?
response: The main objectives of the National Service Scheme (NSS) are to understand the community, understand oneself in relation to the community, identify the needs and problems of the community and involve them in problem-solving, develop among themselves a sense of social and civic responsibility, and more.

instruction: What are the types of activities carried out by NSS volunteers?
response: NSS volunteers carry out two types of activities: regular activities and special camps. Regular activities include contribution in campus beautification, celebrating important days, and activities in adopted areas related to women empowerment, health, education, cleanliness, and other social issues based on community needs. Special camps are seven-day-long activities carried out based on community needs and issues.

instruction: How can I enroll in the National Service Scheme (NSS)?
response: You can download the NSS Enrollment Form from the website and follow the instructions provided to enroll in the National Service Scheme (NSS).

instruction: What is the duration of the National Service Scheme (NSS) program?
response: NSS volunteers devote 120 hours per year for community service.

instruction: What are the benefits of participating in the National Service Scheme (NSS)?
response: Participating in the National Service Scheme (NSS) can help develop a sense of social and civic responsibility, leadership qualities, and democratic attitudes, and provide an opportunity to gain skills in mobilizing community participation and acquire knowledge and experience in community service.

instruction: How can I contact the National Service Scheme (NSS)?
response: You can contact the National Service Scheme (NSS) through the contact information provided on the website or by visiting the institution's office.

instruction: Where is Personal Data processed and transferred?

instruction: How does the company protect Personal Data?
response: The company takes steps reasonably necessary to ensure that Personal Data is treated securely and in accordance with the Privacy Policy, but no method of transmission or electronic storage is 100% secure.

instruction: What is the minimum eligibility criteria for admission?
response: A candidate who has passed 10+2 examination of the Central Board of Secondary Education, New Delhi or its equivalent with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the following subjects : Chemistry, Biotechnology, Computer Science or Biology.

instruction: What are the regulations issued by Panjab University to earn B.E degree in any mentioned stream?
response: According to the Panjab University regulations, the duration of the course of instruction for Bachelor of Engineering in all disciplines shall be Four years (comprising of eight semesters, with two semesters per year). Each semester shall be at least of fourteen weeks duration. A student shall be eligible to appear in the examination only if he/she has attended at least 75% of the total classes held during the semester.

instruction: How to get Provisional Certificate, Character Certificate, Bonafide Certificate, Scholarship certificate from college?
response: Student should fill prescribed Performa available in download tab at ccet website. Student have to clear all his/her dues before issue of certificate.

instruction: What are the different scholarships and fee concessions provided?
response: The following scholarships are available to the students in the college: 1) U.T Merit Scholarships, 3) Free Education for Meritorious Scheduled Castes and Other Backward Classes Students, 5) Merit-cum means based scholarship to minority communities, 7) Tuition Fee Waiver Scheme for Economically Weaker Section students, 9) Half free ship on tuition fee shall be admissible to all the students belonging to the Schedule Caste/ Schedule Tribes.

instruction: Is it possible to transfer branch after first year?
response: Yes, branch can be changed but it would be as per P.U guidelines amended time to time.

instruction: What is the process of counseling for admission to B.E. courses?
response: The process of counseling for admission to B.E. courses is decided by the P.U Syndicate and it is open to a candidate who has passed 10+2 examination of the Central Board of Secondary Education, New Delhi or its equivalent with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with one of the following subjects : Chemistry, Biotechnology, Computer Science or Biology.

instruction: What are the different documents that can be obtained from the college?
response: A student can obtain the following documents from the college: 1) Provisional Certificate 2) Character Certificate 3) Bonafide Certificate 4) Scholarship certificate.

instruction: What is the duration of each semester?
response: Each semester shall be at least of fourteen weeks duration.

instruction: What is the minimum percentage of attendance required to appear for the exam?
response: A student shall be eligible to appear in the examination only if he/she has attended at least 75% of the total classes held during the semester.

instruction: Is it possible to condone the shortage of attendance?
response: Yes, the Board of Control will have the power to condone the shortage of the attendance up to 10% per subject only as per the merit of each case.

instruction: What is the vision of the Mechanical Engineering Department at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: The vision of the Mechanical Engineering Department is to achieve recognition in the field of Mechanical Engineering by developing learned technocrats who excel through research, entrepreneurship, and innovation for sustainable development.

instruction: What are the program outcomes of the B.E. in Mechanical Engineering at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: After completion of B.E. in Mechanical Engineering, the graduates will be able to use the basic knowledge of mathematics, science, and mechanical engineering fundamentals to solve problems related to engineering, design and conduct experiments, interpret and analyze data, and to arrive at meaningful conclusions, conceptualize and design a component, a mechanical system or processes that meet the desired specifications and requirements of the Industry while considering the cultural, society and environmental considerations, work/participate as a member of the team engaged in engineering disciplines, as well as in multi-disciplinary design teams in latest technologies, develop sustainable solutions so as to serve the society with professional ethics, capable of self-learning and development and will be able to adapt to the changes and advancements in technology, and use modern engineering IT tools and equipment to solve mechanical engineering problems with an understanding of the limitations.

instruction: What are the program educational objectives of the Mechanical Engineering Department at Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology?
response: The program educational objectives of the Mechanical Engineering Department are to impart quality education and skill enhancement to the students so as to make them globally competitive mechanical engineers, to maintain state of the art research facilities so as to provide conducive environment that stimulates faculty, staff, and students with opportunities to learn, create, analyze, apply, excel and disseminate knowledge, to develop linkages with world-class R&D organizations and educational institutions in India and abroad for excellence in teaching, research, and consultancy practices, to facilitate the faculty and staff for their professional enrichment, to promote the research activities through sponsored research projects, and to inculcate entrepreneurial and innovative skills in the students.

instruction: What is the Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology (CCET)?
response: The Chandigarh College of Engineering and Technology (CCET) is a government institute under the UT Administration, Chandigarh that was established in 2002. It is affiliated to Panjab University (PU), Sector 14, Chandigarh and approved by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Ministry of HRD, Government of India, New Delhi.

instruction: What are the values of CCET?
response: The mission of CCET is to provide high quality and value based technical education, establish a centre of excellence in emerging and cutting edge technologies, foster a transformative learning environment, and imbibe the spirit of entrepreneurship and innovation. The vision of CCET is to be a centre of excellence for imparting technical education and serving the society with self-motivated and highly competent technocrats.

instruction: What courses are offered by CCET?
response: CCET offers various courses including Degree Course, Degree Course (PU-LEET), and Doctorate (PhD) in several fields such as Computer Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Applied Science.

instruction: What is the aim of the National Service Scheme (NSS)?
response: The main aim of NSS is to develop the personality of students by involving them for community service.

instruction: What is the motto of the National Service Scheme (NSS)?
response: Not Me But You

instruction: What are the objectives of the National Service Scheme (NSS)?
response: To understand the community in which they work, to understand themselves in relation to their community, to identify the needs and problems of the community and involve them in problem-solving, to develop among themselves a sense of social and civic responsibility, to utilize knowledge in finding practical solutions to individual and community problems, to develop competence required for group-living and sharing of responsibilities, to gain skills in mobilizing community participation, to acquire leadership qualities and democratic attitudes, to develop capacity to meet emergencies and natural disasters, to practice national integration and social harmony.

response: Seven days
